page.title: 14HISTORY OF COMBE FLOREY
page.content: Combe Florey is also remarkable for its old sandstone gatehouse (1593), all that is left of the medieval manor house cmplex; there is a later house of 1793, however, which stands at the top of the hill. But Combe Florey is remarkable for two famous literary nAmes : the rector from 1829 was Sydney Smith who, though he feared the country as a kind of "healthy grave" was extremely pleased with his parish.He described it as " a very pretty place in a very beautiful country". The second manor house was occupied until his death in 1966 by the author and wit, Evelyn Waugh.
